Articles.Content:
Help! I recruited too many kerbals in the Astronaut Complex and I need to get rid of them because I'm losing track of my favourite kerbals!

Can anyone think of a solution?

EDIT:

Never mind, I figured it out:

Interestingly, the phrase "to fire" comes from the British, who set miners' houses on fire following their discharge. (If they stole ore)

Your "machine" is more historically accurate than you previously imagined.
Your "solution" may be the most kerbal way to deal with the problem.
That reminds me, I still need to make a kerbal launcher using mainsails pointed the wrong end towards space...

Beware! By default, they will respawn after a time!!!

if you really want them gone permanently you could always hack them out of persistent.sfs... or turn on the 'permadeath' setting in there.
I seriously "LOL"d after seeing your firing method!
I prefer my rocket rover for disposing of unwanted kerbals. It is very similar in design to your solution though. I just use the small SRB same capsules and it has wheels (built in SPH).
You guys are all Kerbal murdering psychopaths 0_0

You guys are all Kerbal murdering psychopaths 0_0

Not all of us.

I didn't like seeing names on the "lost" list, so I sent all of them on a solar escape.

Kindest way to say you're fired.
The Futurama way of "fired". Out of a cannon and into the sun.

It's better than killing them, that's for sure.

The Futurama way of "fired". Out of a cannon and into the sun.

Seconded.

I killed all my Kerbals and then after I started up KSP again they were all alive and well again! WTF

Is this happening to anyone else? I just want to clean out my astronaut list.

*EDIT*

I toggled permadeath after reading the first page of this thread. *facepalm*

Edited July 15, 2014 by JJJacksonTyler

Erm, shoulda also read the timepost of the last message before posting too

Anyway, glad you got your problem solved.

Case Closed!
